body.name: AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-core, 32-thread unlocked desktop processor
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 3 hrs 2 mins
features: The best processor for gamers meets the best processor for creators, with 16 cores and 32 processing threads
Can deliver elite 100 plus FPS performance in the world's most popular games
Cooler not included, liquid cooler recommended
4.9 GHz Max Boost, unlocked for overclocking, 72 MB of cache, DDR-3200 support
For the advanced Socket AM4 platform, can support PCIe 4.0 on X570 and B550 motherboards
body.description: Be unstoppable with the unprecedented speed of the world’s best desktop processors. AMD Ryzen™ 5000 Series processors deliver the ultimate in high performance, whether you’re playing the latest games, designing the next skyscraper or crunching scientific data. With AMD Ryzen™, you’re always in the lead.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 3,882 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great CPU for an AM4 System with a 3900x
reviews.reviewText: Noticeable upgrade from a 3900x. Main system components are this 5950x, an Asus TUF RTX4090, 64GB 3200MHz DDR4, and a Samsung 980 Pro 2TB boot SSD.Noticeable improvement in system responsiveness with apps launching faster and web browsing feeling more fluid. Adobe Lightroom is much faster with the lag gone when tweaking photos. Gaming performance has improved with higher FPS and less screen tearing with VSYNC off. 3dMark score jumped from 16,000 to 23,000 (Timespy). Using a Noctua NH-D15 air cooler temps are good. I see average CPU speed around 4.55GHz jumping to 4.8-4.9GHz under single core loads no problem, much better than the 3900x which never went above 4.1GHz or so ever. Temps are lower with the 5950x too. Very impressed with the CPU and will hold me over for another few years until I build a new system with PCIe 5, DDR5, AM5/Intel, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The last and best CPU AM4 supports!
reviews.reviewText: Getting the 5950x because it's the last powerful CPU that AM4 / X570 supports. Sealed and undamaged box and the CPU works as intended at stock speed.What can you do with more cores?> Give a virtual machine 4 cores.> Give a CPU-only Ai text gen 4 cores.> Limit browsing to 4 cores. (through Processor affinity) ;)Still have plenty left for video editing and maybe streaming and Photoshop and MS Word/Excel and a movie running in the background while doing other stuff at the same time.But to do all that, you need to have a good cooler. The cheapest one i'm getting in 2024 isThermalright Phantom Spirit 120 which is an air cooler. Get a water block if that's what you prefer :DGo 1 step further and ditch your 32gb ram for 128gb. It would help tremendously if you plan to run big Ai models off the new CPU. Them 30-40B Ai models need to be loaded somewhere xD

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This CPU is smokin' fast!
reviews.reviewText: My current PC came with a 12-core AMD 3900X with a base speed of 3.8 GHz and max clock speed of 4.6 GHz. This new 5950X has a base clock speed of 3.4 GHZ and max rated speed of 4.9 GHz.The 5950X replaced the 3900X using the same motherboard, case and cooler. The 5950X runs faster, peaking at 5 GHz but usually averages at 4.45 GHz. my old 3900X would peak at 4.2 GHz and average at 3.9 GHz. What is more amazing is that the 5950X runs a lot cooler than the 3900X. The 5950X peaks at 80 degrees C but averages 72 degrees. My old 3900X peaked at 95 degrees and averaged at 85 degrees. Add the fact that the 5950X draws less power than the 3900X to boot! You can even reduce power consumption by going into Power Options in Control Panel and select Power Saver mode. It will drop the idle CPU speed from 3.5 GHz to 1.7 GHz. But you must revert to AMD Ryzen High Performance or Balanced profiles for the CPU to perform at peak speed and the Power Saver mode throttles the CPU under most cases. Power Saver mode will drop the idle temps from 50+ degrees down to 35-40 degrees.I use my PC for rendering videos. Unfortunately, the software I use does not scale too well with additional cores, but it still makes a difference. What used to take 45 minutes now takes about 35 minutes, so about a 20% increase in speed. Other than rendering, there is not much difference with the new CPU as the 3900X is pretty fast as it is.The big question is whether the 5950X is worth the additional $250 over the 12-core 5900X. If you are using software that takes advantage of the additional four cores, then yes. But for most people, the 12-core 5900X will suit them perfectly, as the 5950X is only about 10-15% faster than the 5900X but at a bump of 30% in price. The 5900X is a better value than the 5950X. It would be interesting to see what AMD will do now since the new Intel 12900K CPU outperforms the AMD at a $150 lower price.But the Intel requires a new motherboard (and the boards are quite expensive), new DDR5 memory (which is REAL expensive) and a heavy-duty cooler since the Intel draws nearly double the power than the AMD and generates a lot more heat, hitting 95 degrees easily. All this means that the Intel, while a cheaper CPU, will cost a few hundred dollars more because the supporting components are a lot more expensive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It runs awesome. It is a little old, but rocks my setup. Asus Crosshair Hero VIII, 64gb Trident Gskill Memory, 2gb Western dig NVME SSD, Nivida RTX 3080,Corsair 7000 case, Corsair Water Cooler Icue H150, Corsair RM1000x Fully Modular ATX Power Supply!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5950x is still future proof
reviews.reviewText: Can't go wrong with the 5950x. Literally plug it into your AM4 socket and it goes right to work.Coming from a 12 core to this 16 core has an obvious speed difference between tasks and runing software (even chrom/firefox) faster. 5950x is still future proof for the foreseeable future. Newer released hardware might show process increases on a benchmark, but real world use case this thing is more bang for your buck... 10 of 10 would buy again!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bigger number better
reviews.reviewText: It does lose to Intel's 13800K but still 5950 is a very high number especially since it has the X ryzen 7 multiplier so it's actually a higher number.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars if you want something just for gaming get a 3d ryzen 7 one or even 5 and safe some money
reviews.reviewText: great for productivity with some gaming on the side

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Month of use review .
reviews.reviewText: 10/10 tasks amazing , ignore anyone who says it’s meant for that only because this processor handles games especially modded ones like beast
Nice and fast compared to my older i7. Peak temperatures at 77C but cooler brings it down to 50s when heavy load.

Gostei de tudo deste produto, é muito eficiente em todos aspectos, para jogar, para renderizar, para compilar programas entre outros, só tem que tem que ter um arrefecimento muito eficiente pois, em 100% de carga ele aquece muito, mas da maneira como instalei ele não passa dos 63º C, e em pouco trabalho funciona de 35 a 43ºC, más uso agua corrente e não agua presa em um radiador que quando é usado por muito tempo aquece também, sem nada a mais no processador só agua que passa por um dissipador térmico com uma pasta térmica de 13.4 W/M*K, só no gabinete que instalai 8 ventoinhas, para refrigerar a placa mãe e a placa de vídeo então, para mim está perfeito para o meu uso, nem sempre se usa 100% de sua capacidade, é muito difícil, então sobra muita potência, era a minha expectativa ter um desses, encaminho os créditos de funcionamento configurações e muitas coisas mais para o nosso querido professor Tito Tech, uma pessoa muito profissional, respeitosa dedicada e carinhosa e é que é parceiro desta loja amazon, com seu canal no Youtube, procurem Tito Tech e assistam seus vídeos, são muito importantes, sobre tecnologia, abraços.
Como usuario Linux Gentoo me ahorra mucho tiempo de compilación y para gaming va de perlas.
Price is fluctuating a lot. 44k to 52k. I bought it. After updation now I am interested to sell my old processor (AMD R5 3600).

Edito.Otra buena noticia.Un programa para controlar la CPU AMD.El Programa CTR 2.1 RC5.Con este programa controlas la estabilidad de la Frecuencia de los MHz.Siempre fluctúa y esto hace que la CPU no sea del todo estable, ahora podremos mantener la Frecuencia y de esta manera la mantenemos estable.Es muy fácil de usar.Yo he decidido bajar la velocidad, que varíe entre 4.350 a 4.400 MHz... Usando la CPU al 100%, no pasa de 60° y tengo todo el rendimiento sin calentarse.En reposo entra entre 30°-32°.También se puede subir, pero será mejor que tengáis una buena refrigeración.Windows volvió a actualizar y volvió a malversar la configuración anterior, la que explico más abajo.Lo único que he podido hacer, después de cambiar muchas veces la configuración para intentar que fuera estable, a sido quitar Hello Windows y desactivar unas cuantas opciones del Windows Defender.Logré que se volviera más estable que antes.Ahora funciona de perlas.Resumen, el procesador no es el problema que tiene a muchos en pie de guerra con AMD, el culpable de los fallos y reinicios por supuestos cortes de energía, es Windows.Windows, un sistema operativo con múltiples fallos, códigos mal depurados y comandos que no son para AMD.---------------------------Edito... Si tenéis problemas en Windows 10/11, con cortes de energía y por supuesto no rinde el PC, hay una solución a dichos problemas que genera Windows.Descargar e instalar este software AMD... AMD Chipset Software 3.10.08.506.0 fallos, 0 cortes de energía, alto rendimiento... Todo un lujo.---------------------------------------Mucha gente se queja que es una tostadora.Pero la verdad es que es estable en temperatura para jugar y trabajar.Como máximo se me pone a 72°... Rindiendo al 100%.90° es lo máximo que soporta este procesador.Con una refrigeración líquida barata y unos ventiladores a 2400rpm, va de lujo.La pasta térmica influye mucho.También hay que configurar los ventiladores para que rindan al 100% cuando llegue a 60°, con juegos AAA, se queda a 60-65°... No todos, hay muchosimos juegos que se queda entre 55-60°.Los Intel de última generación, también son tostadoras... Pero, ahora aguantan más calor todos los procesadores, así que por norma, generan más calor.Quien diga lo contrario, es por qué o no sabe bien cómo funcionan los nuevos procesadores o no sabe bien que componentes le va mejor.MSI Mpeg Gaming Pro Carbón Wifi x570.32Gb Gskill F4 4400MHz.Fuente 1200W.Refrigeración MSI MAG 360M.2 500Gb Principal.30Teras almacén.24 Horas encendido, haciendo Streaming y jugando sin parar... También tengo el servidor de vídeo y archivos todo el día puesto...Y cómo habéis leído, la refrigeración es vieja y barata.
